sen.j: 二卿事件（にきょうじけん）は、明治4年(1871年)、攘夷派の公卿、愛宕通旭と外山光輔が明治政府の転覆を謀ったクーデター未遂事件。
sen.e: The Nikyo Jiken was abortive coup d'etat in which Michiteru OTAGI and Mitsusuke TOYAMA, nobles in joi-ha (supporters of expulsion of the foreigners), attempted an overthrow of the Meiji Government in 1871.

sen.e: The joi-ha all over the nation believed that foreigners would be expelled by the establishment of the Meiji Government whose main members were from Satsuma and Choshu clans that played important roles in the expulsion of the foreigners, but they were deeply disappointed and outraged by the Meiji Government issuing a policy of "Kaikoku Washin (opening the country to the world with peace and amity)" immediately after the end of the Boshin War.

sen.e: At the same time, Michiteru OTAGI, retired from the position of the councilor of Meiji Government and secluded in Kyoto, felt irritated that the court nobles once having participated in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court and being "the guarding wall of the emperor" were taken away from the center of the politics by lower-ranking samurai of Satsuma and Choshu.
